text: How do I get a contact by email address?
<@U018FJJB2PL> do you use the sdk or are you requesting the api endpoint ?
<@U01DF3PNCKA> I was using the api endpoint however I wasnâ€™t really getting anywhere and ended up using the php sdk
Looking at the SDK code I was using the v3 method where the sdk uses v1
seemed very straight forward with v1...
Maybe you choose the old one, let me move from my couch to my computer and I resolve your issue
No rush we can pick this up tomorrow?
Well not sure to have the time tomorrow, but my post will be still there with the answer and  if you have issue with my code (you should not :grin: ) you can ping me.

<@U018FJJB2PL> The php api v3 sdk is here <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php>. And in the github documentation there is this example :

```$hubSpot = \HubSpot\Factory::createWithApiKey('api-key');
$filter  = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Contacts\Model\Filter();
$filter
    ->setOperator('EQ')
    ->setPropertyName('email')
    ->setValue($search);

$filterGroup = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Contacts\Model\FilterGroup();
$filterGroup->setFilters([$filter]);

$searchRequest = new \HubSpot\Client\Crm\Contacts\Model\PublicObjectSearchRequest();
$searchRequest->setFilterGroups([$filterGroup]);

// @var CollectionResponseWithTotalSimplePublicObject $contactsPage
$contactsPage = $hubSpot->crm()->contacts()->searchApi()->doSearch($searchRequest);```

I upload PDFs to HubSpot every day, it does not really care what is inside the uploads as long as the MIME type and the content are OK, they are just treated as binary blobs. I'd advise trying it stubbed out with a saved copy of one of your files and uploading it to see if you get desired behavior using a dev instance:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/get-started>

I can't comment on the client side generation itself, but if the bytes of the PDF are right and you call the API right, it will not care who made it how. You will need some server side code to do the upload to protect your CRM against pwnage of the OAuth or API access used for the upload though
Yeah... but if they are bothering to do it at all might as well just make `upsert`
I hope that move wasn't too far :upside_down_face:
